channel.title: Diff between Tor browser inside whonix and tails and windows
channel.description:
i donno if anyone happened to feel this but im experiencing differences of tor browser inside the 3 operating systems
1- the speed of tor browser inside whonix is faster than tor browser inside windows, is there any reason behind that ?
2- i can play youtube or most of html5 videos inside tail (without installing anythting) while in whonix i cant make youtube to work or any html5 video; is there a reason behind this? like security or anonymity reasons ..etc or its just me whos having these issues ?
(i know whonix doesnt has his own touch on tor but i donno how can i explain these differences)

just saying in case someone might add that to the comparison.

item.title: Diff between Tor browser inside whonix and tails and windows
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Can you try please if vimeo works using the Tor Browser Bundle on a Debian jessie host?
Probably will not?
In that case, it’s an extra feature of Tails perhaps.
Or phrased another way, a missing feature in Tor Browser.
Could you look please, if this issue has been posted on the Tor Browser tracker by The Tor Project?

Read full topic
item.source: Diff between Tor browser inside whonix and tails and windows

item.title: Diff between Tor browser inside whonix and tails and windows
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I’ll look into the video issue later.

[hr]

tail -> Tails. This is important. Because “tail” is a standard command line utility so writing “tail” will side track your question and cause confusion.

That’s up to the Tails support. -> https://tails.boum.org/

Read full topic
item.source: Diff between Tor browser inside whonix and tails and windows

item.title: Diff between Tor browser inside whonix and tails and windows
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
i figured out why the youtube inside Whonix was not working because it was forbidden from working by noscript , so when i disabled the no script youtube worked.

the problem that this case is not similar for the other websites for example like vimeo, here is a pic showing that vimeo is working inside Tails but not inside Whonix:-

So it sounds like Whonix is fine (fast) and Tails is slow. Seems to be eligible to contact the Tails support if you care about this getting fixed.

yeah so true, browsing the tor browser inside whonix is way faster than tor browser inside tail or tor browser alone (inside windows). how can i report this test ? i mean how can i prove or show them that tor inside whonix is faster than the others ? is there commands or websites or …etc ? or i should film that as short video ?

Read full topic
item.source: Diff between Tor browser inside whonix and tails and windows

item.title: Diff between Tor browser inside whonix and tails and windows
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Please post a screenshot if youtube is not working.

So it sounds like Whonix is fine (fast) and Tails is slow. Seems to be eligible to contact the Tails support if you care about this getting fixed.

Read full topic

item.title: Diff between Tor browser inside whonix and tails and windows
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
tail -> Tails donno -> dunno

oh thnx for the corrections (f)

Perhaps you picked a faster/slower entry guard.

well yeah it might be, this is one possibility , but its like always the difference like this.

Youtube html5 videos work for me.

Tails modifies Tor Browser:
https://tails.boum.org/contribute/design/#index40h3
Perhaps more, if you look into Tails source code.

it works for u directly ? it always tell me that i dont have MME or something like that :’(

aha i c Tails modifies the TOR browser.

Read full topic
